pull.title: [p2p] Small follow-ups to 21528
pull.body: Adds a release note & addresses [this](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/21528#discussion_r680963101) review comment to make expectations more explicit.

events.body:
ACK 7ac9c1f22b15509ad1775ecd707ea8615c05d306

Feel free to ignore the optional ideas below.
ACK 7ac9c1f, esp. with @jonatack's suggestions above (e.g. spelling and release notes).

events.message:
[docs] Add release notes for #21528

And fix a typo in the test.

[net_processing] Provide debug error if code assumptions change.

Currently, this call to SetupAddressRelay will never return false because of
the previous guard that returns early if the peer is not an inbound connection.
Rather than implicitly relying on this guarantee, throw an error in the debug
build if it ever changes.

events.body: thanks for reviews! updated to incorporate feedback

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -179,7 +179,7 @@ def relay_tests(self):
         # of the outbound peer which is often sent before the GETADDR response.
         assert_equal(inbound_peer.num_ipv4_received, 0)
 
-        # Send an empty ADDR message to intialize address relay on this connection.
+        # Send an empty ADDR message to initialize address relay on this connection.
comments.body:
nit, maybe fix the other outstanding one too:

```bash
$ test/lint/lint-spelling.sh 
src/wallet/test/spend_tests.cpp:57: neccesary ==> necessary
test/functional/p2p_addr_relay.py:182: intialize ==> initialize
```

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -57,6 +57,10 @@ Notable changes
 P2P and network changes
 -----------------------
 
+- Nodes will no longer forward address gossip to inbound peers by default. The
comments.body:
ideas, for better or worse
```diff
-- Nodes will no longer forward address gossip to inbound peers by default. The
-  peer will become eligible for address gossip upon sending an ADDR, ADDRV2, or
-  GETADDR message. (#21528)
+- By default, bitcoind no longer rumours addresses to inbound peers. They only
+  become eligible for address gossip after sending an ADDR, ADDRV2, or GETADDR
+  message. (#21528)
```

>         // SetupAddressRelay will never fail since this must be an outbound connection.

it can only be an *inbound* connection ;)
